PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
SIPs (Simple Internet Prints) or Print Apps are special print applications available exclusively to HP Web-enabled printers. Print Apps enable quick and easy navigation and print from the web right from a HP Web-enabled printer - no PC needed. Printer user can choose from a growing library of print apps that make printing faster, simpler and more useful than ever.

Print Apps run as HP’s Web services and seamlessly integrate with HP’s web-enabled printers. Firstly upon user interaction Print Apps remotely project a graphical user interaction and controls on to the Web-enabled Printer. Secondly upon user item selection, it acquires HP owned or third-party Web content and generates/renders an appealing print content and finally in response to user print request it mediates the request to another print rendering cloud service – ePrint service - which deliver print job to the printer. Print App archetype is characterized by low latency, high responsive, pre-defined printer UI flows, Web and custom content acquisition; and Internet security.

SIPs Basic Server provides the execution environment for the Print Apps. It also provides many services required by the Print Apps. These services include Security-Service, Load-Balancer, and Reverse-Proxy Service with cache and Proxy Service with cache. Security Service uses HTTP-Digest and OAuth protocol to ensure secure communication between Printer, Print App and the ePrint Service.

ePrint-II is focussed on cost eective implementation of HP Web Print Platform. The core
of this platform is a signal server which is used to notify printers about various events. The
signal server is designed to be high performance server because millions of printer will be
polling concurrently. The platform provides REST APIs which are used by printers for
registering & interacting with the platform. The platform also provides REST APIs for
clients which can use these APIs to operate on the registered printers.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Script Engine For HP App Builder
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: HP App Builder declarative language represents the feed in a tree structure in a Feed XML file. SBS Cloud Service accesses the Feed XML and Content hosted on a Content Feed Service. SBS generates User Interface on the printer and handles the navigation based on the content tree for a given App. Content is grouped into categories, and categories contain either other categories or printable documents. This forms a content tree that user navigates and selects documents to print. A developer may want to secure some of the premium content, generate content sub-trees based on user preferences and/or context information, and transform some of the contents on the fly. Developer adds Scripting extensions to the declarative feed XML that handle custom requirements of the App.

The Developer portal's objective was to provide an online tool for App Builder developers. The portal had automated workflows for creating, developing, deploying and maintaining Apps. I had implemented JCR compliant content repository for storage \& retrieval of each app's data. Apart from that I was involved in desiging and developing back-end services for use by the front-end UI. These back-end services took care of user management, app's state management etc.

HP App Builder aims to reduce the development effort for developing a Print App. Many of the Print Apps fall in the category of Content Browser apps where the app facilitates a printer user to browse and print content. Since there are a huge number of apps which fall in this category, there was an obvious need to build a system which can automate the development of this category of Print Apps. This system eliminated the need for developing a separate Print App for each set of Printable Content. With this system app development was just a matter of configuration.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Web Print Platform - Reliability, Availability, Scalability
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: This project was focussed on making the ePrint platform recover gracefully in case of infrastructure events such as network outages and machine crashes..
